channel.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
channel.description:
[url]https://www.facebook.com/pages/Joseph-Hill-Joss-Whedon/95553331655?v=wall&story_fbid=128556790489136[/url]
Alright, so this is just a rumor and may not be true at all.
Now, I loved Firefly and the movie Serenity. I think Joss Whedon would make a decent HL movie. Also Nathan Fillion as Barney would be perfect.
BUT FOR THE LOVE OF FUCK I HOPE THIS IS NOT REAL! Half-Life doesn't need a freaking movie.

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.description:
I’d like to see the movie based on the HECU’s experiences in Black Mesa and/or the Seven Hour War.

Oh wait, it’s fake, nevermind.

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Jeannotvb:

A Half-Life movie would be good for marketing, that’s probably what Hollywood is thinking with their shitty scripts.

Sorry but this sentence is really confusing. Do you mean that since Half-Life already has an established fanbase, Hollywood thinks they can get away with half-assing the script since they know Half-Life fans will see it no matter what?

Jeannotvb:

Good thing Valve isn’t that kind of studio, unlike 99% out there who will sell their rights the minute big shot studios offer them money.

Yes, I think we can all agree that if Valve ever allowed a movie to be made, they would make sure it was up to their standards of quality. So there’s really no need for worrying - if one ever comes out it will be kickass.

Read full topic

item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: Sitten_duck
item.description:
I sent Gabe Newell an email a little while back, and according to him, they are still looking into making a Half-Life movie. However, instead of relying on Hollywood to write a script, (they’ve already gotten couple bad scripts from Hollywood) they are “teaching themselves how to write a linear narrative” he said that their attempts can be seen the TF2 shorts, L4D intro (this was before L4D2), and maybe something else, I can’t quite remember atm. But Gabe is pretty adament that they aren’t going to do anything that would potentially ruin their brand.

edit:

Gabe Newell stated by himself, that there will be no Half Life movie just because of the famous name!

Where did he say that? I haven’t heard that anywhere, and the email I got from him seemed to imply just the opposite, that they haven’t completely given up on a Half-Life movie.

Read full topic
item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: Stuntz
item.description:
I know, that most of you guys know valve well enough to even think that a hl movie would even exist. Especially since how the game is set up anyways, to make YOU experience the universe. Anyways interesting thread, but a half-life movie, even a side story movie, has a 0% chance of seeing light.

Read full topic
item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: Vibez
item.description:
The only idea that could work would have to be as mysterious as the whole game. So, I would totally like to see anything explaining Black Mesa Research Facility itself, it’s history, and other parts of the complex. I would also add G-Man somewhere and connect ‘movie’ plots with original game plots. The movie shouldn’t include Freeman. The fact we can’t even see him in the game says for itself, it should stay that way.

But hey, lets face the truth - that could turn into anotther boring Hollywood shit. Another secret project & alien shooting. We’ve seen that many times already and most of them were crap.

Read full topic
item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Dias:

Doesn’t change the fact that silent films existed, or the fact that they can still be made.
Ever see samurai jack? I’ve heard so many jokes about how a zelda, metroid, anything, movie could be made like that.

Yeah, but silent films weren’t without dialogue, it just had to be written instead of spoken. If you’ve ever seen a truly silent movie/video, one with very little or no dialogue (such as the Triplets of Belleville), you quickly see how surreal an atmosphere it creates. However, that effect comes from the fact that nobody speaks, so I’m not really sure what would happen if only one character was silent, but I suspect it might be kind of awkward. I haven’t seen Samurai Jack so correct me if I’m wrong, if it does work out ok.

As for a movie, I don’t really care if they make one or not as long as it isn’t badly made. If they don’t make one, nothing changes. If they do, Valve won’t let it suck. So I’m not really worried.

Read full topic
item.source: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?

item.title: [Rumorville] Joss Whedon may direct possible HL movie?
item.dc:creator: _amp_955_dam
item.description:
Gordon-Freeman:

Why do people do not like a Half Life 1 movie? This will be awesome, You can see Gordon shooting aliens and military’s while navigating his way to the surface, watching him crawl on a vent and holding the mighty crowbar and seeing the H.E.V suit, It will be awesome just like the times.

Or you could, oh I don’t know, play the game?

Dias:

Especially not a damn side-story or interquel like most of you schmucks like to suggest.

Oi, I’m not a schmuck. Even so, I’m happy that it was a fake, I’d rather there not be a film.

Also, what’s the name of that guy who did the silent films? I recognize him from a film I saw the other day.

Read full topic
